description: Creates an AvailabilityConfiguration for the given WorkMail organization and domain.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: An idempotent token that ensures that an API request is executed only once. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: OrganizationId
parameters.description: The WorkMail organization for which the AvailabilityConfiguration will be created.

parameters.name: DomainName
parameters.description: The domain to which the provider applies.

parameters.name: EwsProvider
parameters.description: Exchange Web Services (EWS) availability provider definition. The request must contain exactly one provider definition, either EwsProvider or LambdaProvider. The endpoint of the remote EWS server. The username used to authenticate the remote EWS server. The password used to authenticate the remote EWS server.

nested_params.name: EwsEndpoint
nested_params.description: The endpoint of the remote EWS server.

nested_params.name: EwsUsername
nested_params.description: The username used to authenticate the remote EWS server.

nested_params.name: EwsPassword
nested_params.description: The password used to authenticate the remote EWS server.

parameters.name: LambdaProvider
parameters.description: Lambda availability provider definition. The request must contain exactly one provider definition, either EwsProvider or LambdaProvider. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda that acts as the availability provider.

nested_params.name: LambdaArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda that acts as the availability provider.
